lead_paragraph: A growing body of economic literature suggests that efforts in America aimed at things like “maintaining neighborhood character” contribute to segregation and lead to stagnation.

headline.print_headline: When Cities Spurn Growth, Equality Suffers
headline.main: How Anti-Growth Sentiment, Reflected in Zoning Laws, Thwarts Equality

snippet: A growing body of economic literature suggests that efforts in America aimed at things like “maintaining neighborhood character” contribute to segregation and lead to stagnation....
abstract: Economic research shows anti-growth sentiment in cities across United States is major factor in creating stagnant and less equal American society; scholars say overly restrictive zoning laws can reduce housing where need is greatest and result in lower-income people moving where housing is cheap, rather than to places with most job opportunity; Boulder, Co, is one place caught in zoning tension.
